content:
There are several sources where you can find environmental engineering datasets. Some popular options include:

1. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) - offers a wide range of datasets related to climate, weather, and oceanography.
2. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) - provides datasets on air and water quality, hazardous waste, and other environmental topics.
3. United States Geological Survey (USGS) - offers datasets on water resources, geology, and natural hazards.
4. Data.gov - a government-run website that provides access to a wide variety of datasets from various federal agencies, including those related to the environment.
5. World Bank - provides datasets on various environmental and development topics, including water and sanitation, air pollution, and climate change.
6. Kaggle - is a website that hosts a variety of datasets, including those related to environmental engineering and science.

These are some of the popular sources, there are also many other sources available on internet you can find it with little more research.
